greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n, k) read by rows giving number of non-equivalent ways to choose k points in an equilateral triangle grid of side n.
comment: Number of orbits under dihedral group D_6 of order 6. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Sep 12 2019
link: Heinrich Ludwig, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..173
example: Triangle T(n, k) is irregularly shaped: 0 <= k <= n*(n+1)/2+1. The first row corresponds to n = 1, the first column corresponds to k = 0. Rows are palindromic.
There are T(3, 2) = 4 nonisomorphic choices of 2 points (X) in an equilateral triangle grid of side 3:
results.author: _Heinrich Ludwig_, Nov 14 2013
